titleStmt.title: The second set of madrigals, and pastorals, of 3. 4. 5. and 6. parts apt for violls and voyces: newly composed by Francis Pilkington, Batchelar of Musicke, and lutenist, and chaunter of the Cathedrall Church of Christ, and blessed Mary the Virgin, in Chester.
Madrigals and pastorals. Set 1
titleStmt.author: Pilkington, Francis, d. 1638.
Derby, William Stanley, Earl of, d. 1642.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Snodham, for M[atthew] L[ownes] and A. B[rowne],

notesStmt.note: Six partbooks, each with separate dated title page and register. At head of title, part 1, "Cantus."; part 2, "Altus."; part 3, "Tenor."; part 4, "Bassus."; part 5, "Quintus."; part 6, "Sextus.". The Altus part contains tablature for a pavanne for orpharion by William Stanley, Earl of Derby.
